objects.name: Analytic 0328
objects.description: Links inbound network access to SSHD/SMB/NFS/Databases or custom daemons with subsequent daemon crash/restart, core dump, or spawning of shells/reverse shells from the service context, indicating remote exploitation.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:syslog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: kernel|systemd messages indicating 'segmentation fault'|'core dumped'|'service terminated unexpectedly' for sshd, smbd, vsftpd, mysqld, httpd, etc.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: execve of /bin/sh,/bin/bash,/usr/bin/curl,/usr/bin/python by service accounts (e.g., apache, mysql, nobody) immediately after inbound network activity.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Inbound connections to monitored service ports from external or unusual internal sources; rapid follow-on lateral connections from the same host.

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Linux daemons to watch (sshd, smbd, nfsd, httpd/nginx, mysqld, postgres, redis).
Paths/users allowed to spawn shells from services (default: empty).
